headline: How To Cook Boneless, Skinless Chicken Thighs in the Oven
description: Cooking chicken thighs in the oven is as easy as 1-2-3.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oven and season the chicken. Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 425°F. Place 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. The most basic seasoning that this meat really needs is salt and pepper. At this point, if I'm not adding another sauce, I drizzle a little bit of olive oil over the meat too, to help it brown well in the oven.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Make a sauce (optional). Mince 4 cloves garlic and place in a medium bowl. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, and 1 teaspoon packed brown sugar. Whisk until combined.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Toss the chicken with the sauce. Pour the sauce over the chicken and toss to combine.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the chicken to a baking dish. Place the chicken in a single layer in an 8- or 9-inch baking dish. No need to grease the dish, just lay the chicken inside.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Roast the chicken. Boneless, skinless thighs cook quickly. Roast until the chicken has an internal temperature of 165°F, about 20 minutes. If they are not ready, continue roasting and checking the temperature every 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Rest the chicken. Remove the baking dish from the oven, cover with aluminum foil, and let the chicken rest for 10 minutes. This will help it be more tender. Eat and enjoy!

HowtoTip.text: Doubling: You can double this recipe and bake the chicken in a 9x13-inch baking dish.Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.

review.reviewBody: This is a great low-cost option that's simple and has a lot of flavor. Holds really well for leftover salads and sandwiches too.
I LOVE using thighs instead of breasts -- so much more flavorful

I made this last night for us and a friend we all enjoyed it. I let it rest for the 10 minutes and it was melt in the mouth and the sauce is awsome  although I left out the garlic and used chilli powder as I had no red pepper flakes

I was so bummed when I realized I was out of grill gas and it was roughly about 8:00 PM. So I googled how to cook boneless skinless chicken thighs without a grill. This came up and I love to cook. I love cooking tastes and using all kinds of seasonings and blah blah blah. So I looked at it and said OK salt, pepper, olive oil. IT IS SOOOO GOOD! Thank you!

video.name: Easy Chicken Thighs In The Oven
video.description:
I am a huge, huge fan of boneless, skinless chicken thighs. They are inexpensive, tasty, and easy to cook. In fact, I find it difficult to mess up chicken thighs. They are just dark enough to stay tender, but not so dark as to put off people who prefer white meat. Everyone who eats regularly at my house has eaten chicken thighs! Easy Chicken Thighs in the Oven: Watch the Video Chicken Thighs in the Oven Are Quick! In the summer I grill these babies every week, especially when I have a big table of people to feed. But in the winter, when I don't feel like stepping outside to the grill but do feel like turning on the oven, I bake the chicken in the oven. It's easy as 1-2-3. Here's what I do.

See full recipe post [HERE](https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-cook-boneless-skinless-chicken-thighs-in-the-oven-180140)

name: How To Cook Boneless, Skinless Chicken Thighs in the Oven

author.name: Faith Durand
author.description: Faith is the SVP of Content at Apartment Therapy Media and former Editor-in-Chief of The Kitchn. She is the author of three cookbooks, including the James Beard Award-winning The Kitchn Cookbook. She lives in Columbus, Ohio, with her husband and two daughters.
